name: This Bugs for You Trivia Game | Various Cartoon Characters | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Knighty Knight Bugs" is a Bugs Bunny cartoon that has the distinction of being honored with what prestigious award?
questions.explanation:
Oscar.

	"Knighty Knight Bugs" is the only Bugs Bunny cartoon to win an Oscar for best short film. The plot has Bugs Bunny trying to retrieve a singing sword from the black knight or face death. While in Bugs Bunny's hands the sword plays "Farewell to Thee" and "Cuddle up a little closer, Lovey Mine". The cartoon aired for the first time on August 23, 1958 and ran for six minutes twenty-eight seconds. Yosemite Sam guest stars as the black knight.

questions.text: What was one of the things Bugs Bunny did NOT do to Yosemite Sam to get him to leave Granny alone in "Hare Trimmed"?
options: Cause a bus to hit him
questions.explanation:
Shoot at him.

	ABC's most aired Bugs Bunny cartoon was "Hare Trimmed" guest starring Yosemite Sam and Granny. "Hare Trimmed" first aired on June 20, 1953 at six minutes fifty-four seconds. Bea Benaderet was the uncredited voice of Granny.

questions.text: What was the fairy-tale Bugs Bunny was reading while walking in the forest on "Bewitched Bunny"?
options: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
questions.explanation:
Hansel and Gretel.

	While out walking and reading his book of fairy tales, Bugs Bunny came upon a real life Hansel and Gretel scene. He saved Hansel and Gretel by alerting them to the witches plan. In the process, he was captured by the witch. With the help of a spell, Bugs Bunny accidentally turned the witch into a female rabbit. The cartoon first aired on July 24, 1954 and lasted six minutes and  fifty-six seconds.

questions.text: As Bugs Bunny's stunt double in "A Star is Bored", to what was the first offense Daffy Duck was subjected?
questions.correct: Daffy was shot by Yosemite Sam
options: Daffy was run over by a train
Daffy was hit in the head by Granny
Daffy was blown up by Elmer Fudd
questions.explanation:
Daffy was shot by Yosemite Sam.

	"A Star is Bored" played for the first time on September 15, 1956. The cartoon ran for seven minutes eleven seconds. Upset that Bugs Bunny got all the good scenes, Daffy was placed into the movie by the producers as a stunt double. Daffy went through horrendous events as the stunt double of Bugs Bunny until he became fed up and left.

questions.text: What was the first cartoon that featured the prototype Bugs Bunny?
questions.explanation:
Porky's Hare Hunt.

	In "Porky's Hare Hunt", Bugs Bunny had a different look and no name. In the cartoon, while out hunting, Porky Pig tried to kill Bugs Bunny. The cartoon lasted eight minutes and first aired on April 30, 1938.

questions.text: On the front of the evil scientist castle in "Water, Water Every Hare" , the words 'Evil Scientist' flash in neon lights. What is the next word that flashes underneath 'Evil Scientist'?
questions.explanation:
Boo.

	"Water Water Every Hare" is a play on the line from the poem 'The Rhime of the Ancient Mariner'. The cartoon was released on April 19, 1952 at seven minutes twenty-six seconds. Gossamer, the big, red giant, co-stars with Bugs Bunny in the cartoon.

questions.text: Who thought they were more deserving of a "This is a Life?" Award than Bugs Bunny was in the cartoon, "This is a Life?"
questions.explanation:
Daffy Duck.

	"This is a Life?", aired for the first time on July 9, 1955 at seven minutes. Elmer Fudd was the MC for the TV show "This is a Life?" Bugs, Daffy, and Granny were audience members and Bugs Bunny was chosen as the recipient of the award. On stage, Bugs Bunny had such a big head about all the things he did to Elmer Fudd and Yosemite Sam that they awarded him with a bomb. Bugs Bunny got wind of what was happening and rejected the award. Daffy Duck wanted the award so badly that he swiped the box from Bugs Bunny just as it blew up.

questions.text: This cartoon starring Bugs Bunny and guest starring Elmer Fudd was the first Bugs Bunny cartoon to be entered into the national film registry. What was the title of the cartoon?
questions.explanation:
What's Opera, Doc?.

	"What's Opera, Doc" first aired on July 6, 1957 and ran for six minutes fifty seven seconds. The cartoon is considered the #1 cartoon of all time. The plot has Bugs Bunny and Elmer Fudd acting out an opera by Wagner. In the end, Elmer Fudd kills Bugs Bunny and Bugs Bunny awakens long enough to remind the viewing audience that it is an opera.

questions.text: In "Wild and Wooly Hare", what was the name of the saloon where Yosemite Sam met Bugs Bunny?
questions.explanation:
Fat Chance Saloon.

	"Wild and Wooly Hare" first aired on August 1, 1959 at six minutes forty-one seconds. The plot has Bugs Bunny saving a train from being robbed by Yosemite Sam.

questions.text: What was the name of the last Bugs Bunny cartoon?
questions.explanation:
False Hare.

	"False Hare" first aired on July 18, 1964. It was the last Bugs Bunny cartoon to air until 1990. The cartoon ran for six minutes. In the plot, Bugs Bunny is initiated into an all rabbits club by two wolves anxious to eat him. Bored and wise to what the wolves are planning, Bugs Bunny goes along with the plan, thwarting the wolves at every misdeed. Foghorn Leghorn guest stars when the beaten wolf decides to open an all chicken club.
